item.title: Nextdoor redesigns app with AI recommendations, local news, and real-time emergency alerts
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: Neighborhood social app Nextdoor is launching a redesigned version of its service that it’s calling the “new Nextdoor.”

item.title: Tesla finally enters India — nine years after Elon Musk first teased its debut
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: Tesla has made its long-awaited entry into India with the opening of its first showroom in Mumbai.

item.title: Meta is reportedly using actual tents to build data centers
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Meta and CEO Mark Zuckerberg are in a hurry to build their superintelligence tech. The company has been poaching AI researchers, while Zuckerberg announced on Monday that Meta is building a 5-gigawatt data center called Hyperion. The urgency is palpable. As SemiAnalysis reported last week and Business Insider noted, Meta is so eager to boost […]

item.title: Nvidia is set to resume China chip sales after months of regulatory whiplash
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: Nvidia announced Monday that it’s filing applications to restart sales of its H20 artificial intelligence chips to China, capping a spasmodic few months that saw the Trump administration impose restrictions, then quickly reverse course after a high-profile dinner meeting. The company expects to receive U.S. government licenses soon and begin deliveries shortly after, according to […]

item.title: Brian Singerman is raising over $500M for a new fund with a twist on the VC model
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: Former Founders Fund GP Brian Singerman and co-founder and managing partner of Quiet Capital, Lee Linden, are seeking over $500 million for a new fund called GPx, three people familiar with their strategy told TechCrunch. A significant portion of GPx's fund, potentially as much as 50%, will come from Founders Fund co-founder Peter Thiel, these people said.

item.title: Meta built its AI reputation on openness — that may be changing
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: Top members of Meta’s new Superintelligence Lab discussed pivoting away from the company’s powerful open source AI model, Behemoth, and instead developing a closed model. This would mark a major philosophical shift for Meta.

item.title: Former Sequoia partner Matt Miller raises $355M for new fund — with Sequoia’s backing
item.dc:creator: Anna Heim
item.description: Former Sequoia partner Matt Miller has already locked in $355 million for his new fund, Evantic, which is also backed by Sequoia, TechCrunch learned.

item.title: Following YouTube, Meta announces crackdown on ‘unoriginal’ Facebook content
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Like YouTube, Meta says it won't penalize users who are engaging with other people's content, doing things like making reaction videos, joining a trend, or adding their own takes.

item.title: Episource is notifying millions of people that their health data was stolen
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker
item.description: The UnitedHealth-owned medical coding service was hacked earlier this year by a ransomware gang.

item.title: Cognition, maker of the AI coding agent Devin, acquires Windsurf
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description: The announcement comes just days after Google hired away Windsurf's CEO Varun Mohan, co-founder Douglas Chen, and research leaders in a $2.4 billion reverse-acquihire that left much of the startup's 250-person team behind.

item.title: Trump administration to spend $1 billion on ‘offensive’ hacking operations
item.dc:creator: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
item.description: A top Democrat criticized the move to spend a billion on offensive hacking operations as the budget guts a billion from U.S. cyber defense.

item.title: As the browser wars heat up, here are the hottest alternatives to Chrome and Safari in 2025
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: We’ve compiled an overview of some of the top alternative browsers available today aiming to challenge Chrome and Safari.

item.title: Elon Musk’s Grok is making AI companions, including a goth anime girl
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: Musk wrote in an X post on Monday that AI companions are now available in the Grok app for "Super Grok" subscribers who pay $30 per month.

item.title: Malaysia will require trade permits for US AI chips
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: Malaysia is introducing new export restrictions on U.S. AI chips in an attempt to prevent these chips from being smuggled into China.

item.title: NotebookLM adds featured notebooks from The Economist, The Atlantic, and others
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Google is adding notebooks from various authors, publications, researchers, and nonprofits to its popular AI-powered research and note-taking assistant NotebookLM.

item.title: Prime Day event drove over $24B in US e-commerce sales, GenAI traffic was up 3,300%
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Amazon's Prime Day, which leads to an overall boost to U.S. e-commerce thanks to competitive sales, saw a significant increase in retail traffic driven by generative AI products, including chatbots and browsers.

item.title: Mark Zuckerberg says Meta is building a 5GW AI data center
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description: Mark Zuckerberg says Meta is building out some massive data centers to power its AI ambitions and compete with OpenAI, Google, and Anthropic.

item.title: Weekly subscriptions dominate iOS app revenue, report finds
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Weekly subscriptions have now become one of the most popular ways iOS apps are earning revenue, with these plans contributing 46% to the bottom line, according to a new report by app revenue management platform Adapty.

item.title: GM to challenge China’s LFP monopoly with upgraded battery factory
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: The factory’s overhaul will give U.S. LFP production a significant boost.

item.title: Rainmaker partners with Atmo to squeeze more rain from clouds
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: Atmo will use its deep learning models to help Rainmaker identify clouds that have potential for seeding.
